member.name: T:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration
member.summary: Class encapsulating configuration properties to customize indexing of documents to Azure Search service.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.Instance
member.summary: Returns instance.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.DocumentsBatchSize
member.summary: Maximum number of search documents processed per batch in one request to the Azure Search service (index uploads, merges or deletes).

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.DocumentSearchPageSize
member.summary: Document count per page when searching Azure Search indexes.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.MaxBackoffTimeSeconds
member.summary: Maximum time interval (in seconds) between two attempts to perform Azure search operations. The interval starts from 0 and grows exponentially up to the maximum: 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, ...

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.RetryCount
member.summary: Maximum number of retry attempts that the system performs after an Azure Search operation fails.
member.remarks: Setting the retry count to zero disables the retry strategy. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.SearchEngineConfiguration.TransientErrorDetectionStrategy
member.summary: Defines an object responsible for detecting specific transient conditions on Azure Search service operations. By default every exception is handled as transient and so the operation that caused exception will be retried.
member.remarks: May improve performance by skipping retry strategy of an operation for specific exceptions.

member.name: T:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper

summary.para: Provides mapping of data types and their values from .NET types to Azure Search types.
The implementation can map , , , , , and of types directly to their Azure counterparts. Types and are mapped as and respectively.

member.remarks: Certain mappings can cause loss of precision. Azure Search does not support sub-millisecond precision of date time. The type is mapped to , which can lead to round-off errors.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.Instance
member.summary: Gets the instance.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new data mapper instance with default mappings.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.RegisterMapping(System.Type,Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.DataType,System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a new mapping of to Azure Search along with a function for conversion of source values to target values directly assignable to Azure Search API.
member.param: Type for which to register the mapping.
Azure Search data type to be used for storing values of type .
Function converting source value to value of type which is directly assignable to Azure Search API. Leave null to keep the value as is.

remarks.para: Some types like or are directly assignable to Azure Search. On the contrary is explicitly converted to a string as the default mapping stores as a .
In order to avoid unexpected behavior while performing implicit conversions by the Azure Search API, it is recommended to always provide a conversion function.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.RegisterMappingCore(System.Type,CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.DataMapping)
member.summary: Registers a new mapping and atomically publishes it.

member.summary: Gets Azure Search suitable for given .
member.param: Type for which to return corresponding Azure Search data type.
member.returns: Azure Search data type suitable for .
member.exception: Thrown when has no suitable mapping.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.DataMapper.ConvertValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Coverts of type supported by this mapper to result of type suitable for Azure Search.
member.param: Value of type supported by this mapper.
member.returns: Result of type suitable for Azure Search.
member.exception: Thrown when has no conversion defined (i.e. corresponding mapping in does not exist).

member.summary: Defines a mapping result containing Azure data type and corresponding conversion function.

member.summary: Gets Azure Search .

member.summary: Gets function whose result is directly assignable to index field of type in Azure Search.

member.summary: Maps source .NET types to Azure Search data types and corresponding conversion functions. The conversion function converts to an object of type which is directly assignable to Azure Search field (i.e. the function is to perform an explicit conversion to avoid implicit conversions in Azure Search.

member.name: T:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper
member.summary: Utility class for Azure Search fields.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidFieldName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets field name which is valid to be used for Azure Search index.
member.param: Field name to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.

remarks.para:
Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which field names must follow. Remarkably
Allowed characters are letters, numbers and dashes ('_').
First character must be a letter.
Since system fields start with a dash (e.g. ), the default implementation prefixes dash starting name of column by string "sys".

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidDocumentKey(System.String)
member.summary: Gets document key which is valid to be used for Azure Search document.
member.param: Document key to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.
member.returns: Returns document key where semicolons are replaced by dashes.

remarks.para: Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which document keys must follow.
Since the system uses semicolon (';') as a delimiter for compound identifiers, the default implementation replaces all semicolons by dashes ('-').

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidIndexName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets valid index name for Azure Search service.
member.param: Index name to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.
member.remarks: Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which index names must follow.
member.returns: Returns string that has first character a letter or number and dots are replaced with dashes.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidFieldNameInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Gets field name which is valid to be used for Azure Search index.
member.param: Field name to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.

remarks.para:
Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which field names must follow. Remarkably
Allowed characters are letters, numbers and dashes ('_').
First character must be a letter.
Since system fields start with a dash (e.g. ), the default implementation prefixes dash starting name of column by string "sys".

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidDocumentKeyInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Gets document key which is valid to be used for Azure Search document.
member.param: Document key to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.
member.returns: Returns document key where semicolons are replaced by dashes.

remarks.para: Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which document keys must follow.
Since the system uses semicolon (';') as a delimiter for compound identifiers, the default implementation replaces all semicolons by dashes ('-').

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.NamingHelper.GetValidIndexNameInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Gets valid index name for Azure Search service.
member.param: Index name to be renamed so it fulfills Azure Search naming conventions.
member.remarks: Azure Search has naming rules (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/searchservice/naming-rules) which index names must follow.
member.returns: Returns string that has first character a letter or number and dots are replaced with dashes.

member.name: T:CMS.Search.Azure.ExponentialRetryStrategy
member.summary: Performs exponential retry strategy.
member.remarks: Time interval between two attempts is exponentially increased. Retry is performed after 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 ... seconds limited by .

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.ExponentialRetryStrategy.RetryCount
member.summary: Number of retry attempts to perform after operation fails for the first time.
member.remarks: Retry count may equal zero, to not perform any retry strategy.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.ExponentialRetryStrategy.MaxBackoffTimeSeconds
member.summary: Defines maximum time in seconds that is awaited between two attempts to perform a failed operation.

member.name: P:CMS.Search.Azure.ExponentialRetryStrategy.TransientErrorDetectionStrategy
member.summary: Defines an object responsible for detecting specific transient conditions on Azure Search service operations. By default every exception is handled as transient.

member.name: M:CMS.Search.Azure.ExponentialRetryStrategy.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates exponential retry strategy for Azure Search service operations.
member.param: Number of retry attempts to perform after operation fails in the first attempt.
Defines maximum time in seconds that is awaited between two attempts to perform a failed operation.

member.summary: Creates exponential retry strategy for Azure Search service operations.
member.param: Number of retry attempts to perform after operation fails in the first attempt.

Defines an object responsible for detecting specific transient conditions.
